content.text:
# List of Intangible Cultural Heritage elements in Croatia

]]
The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO) intangible cultural heritage elements are the non-physical traditions and practices performed by a people. As part of a country's cultural heritage, they include celebrations, festivals, performances, oral traditions, music, and the making of handicrafts. The "intangible cultural heritage" is defined by the Convention for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage, drafted in 2003 and took effect in 2006. Inscription of new heritage elements on the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists is determined by the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage, an organisation established by the convention.
Croatia ratified the convention 28 July 2005.
Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity

! scope="row" | Two-part singing and playing in the Istrian scale
|
| 2009
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/two-part-singing-and-playing-in-the-istrian-scale-00231 00231]
| The two-part singing and playing in the Istrian scale is a traditional singing practice characteristic of the Istrian region and the north Adriatic coastal area and islands.
|-
! scope="row" | Festivity of Saint Blaise, the patron of Dubrovnik
|
| 2009
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/festivity-of-saint-blaise-the-patron-of-dubrovnik-00232 00232]
| The Festivity of Saint Blaise is a festivity organized on 3 February continuously since the year 972 in Dubrovnik.
|-
! scope="row" | Traditional manufacturing of children's wooden toys in Hrvatsko Zagorje
|
| 2009
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/traditional-manufacturing-of-children-s-wooden-toys-in-hrvatsko-zagorje-00233 00233]
| The traditional children's wooden toys manufactured in the region of Zagorje.
|-
! scope="row" | Spring procession of Ljelje/Kraljice (queens) from Gorjani
|
| 2009
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/spring-procession-of-ljelje-kraljice-queens-from-gorjani-00235 00235]
| The Procession of Queens is a yearly spring ritual performed in the village of Gorjani.
|-
! scope="row" | Procession Za križen ('following the cross') on the island of Hvar
|
| 2009
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/procession-za-krizen-following-the-cross-on-the-island-of-hvar-00242 00242]
| Za križen –following the cross– is a night procession that happens every Maundy Thursday on the island of Hvar.
|-
! scope="row" | Annual carnival bell ringers' pageant from the Kastav area
|
| 2009
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/annual-carnival-bell-ringers-pageant-from-the-kastav-area-00243 00243]
| Zvončari –bellmen– is a folk custom maintained in the Kastav area.
|-
! scope="row" | Lacemaking in Croatia
|
| 2009
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/lacemaking-in-croatia-00245 00245]
| Lacemaking of the towns of Pag (Pag lace), Lepoglava (), and Hvar (Hvar lace).
|-
! scope="row" | Gingerbread craft from Northern Croatia
|
| 2010
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/gingerbread-craft-from-northern-croatia-00356 00356]
| Licitars are colorfully decorated biscuits made of sweet honey dough. They are often erroneously referred to as gingerbread, although they do not actually contain ginger.
|-
! scope="row" | Sinjska alka, a knights’ tournament in Sinj
|
| 2010
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/sinjska-alka-a-knights-tournament-in-sinj-00357 00357]
| The Sinjska alka is an equestrian competition held in Sinj every first Sunday in August since 1715.
|-
! scope="row" | Bećarac singing and playing from Eastern Croatia
|
| 2011
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/bearac-singing-and-playing-from-eastern-croatia-00358 00358]
| Bećarac is a humorous form of folk song, originally from rural Slavonia.
|-
! scope="row" | Nijemo kolo, silent circle dance of the Dalmatian hinterland
|
| 2011
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/nijemo-kolo-silent-circle-dance-of-the-dalmatian-hinterland-00359 00359]
| Nijemo kolo is a silent dance originating from the Dalmatian Hinterland.
|-
! scope="row" | Klapa multipart singing of Dalmatia, southern Croatia
|
| 2012
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/klapa-multipart-singing-of-dalmatia-southern-croatia-00746 00746]
| Klapa music is a form of traditional a cappella singing with origins in Dalmatia.
|-
! scope="row" style="background:#D0E7FF;"| Mediterranean diet +
|
| 2013
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/mediterranean-diet-00884 00884]
| The Mediterranean diet is the traditional food and methods of preparation used by the people of the Mediterranean basin, as well as everything related to them.
|-
! scope="row" style="background:#D0E7FF;"| Art of dry stone construction, knowledge and techniques +
|
| 2018
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/art-of-dry-stone-construction-knowledge-and-techniques-02106 02106]
| Dry stone is a building method by which structures are constructed from stones without any mortar to bind them together.
|-
! scope="row" | Međimurska popevka, a folksong from Međimurje
|
| 2018
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/meimurska-popevka-a-folksong-from-meimurje-01396 01396]
| Međimurska popevka is a folk song originating from the Međimurje County.
|-
! scope="row" style="background:#D0E7FF;"| Falconry, a living human heritage +
|
| 2021
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/falconry-a-living-human-heritage-01708 01708]
| The origin of falconry goes back to the use of hunting by birds of prey as a mean of hunting but it has evolved over time to become part of the cultural heritage of the people.
|-
! scope="row" style="background:#D0E7FF;"| Lipizzan horse breeding traditions +
|
| 2022
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/lipizzan-horse-breeding-traditions-01687 01687]
|
|-
! scope="row" | Festivity of Saint Tryphon and the Kolo (chain dance) of Saint Tryphon, traditions of Croats from Boka Kotorska (Bay of Kotor) who live in the Republic of Croatia
|
| 2022
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/festivity-of-saint-tryphon-and-the-kolo-chain-dance-of-saint-tryphon-traditions-of-croats-from-boka-kotorska-bay-of-kotor-who-live-in-the-republic-of-croatia-01891 01891]
|
|-
! scope="row" style="background:#D0E7FF;"| Transhumance, the seasonal droving of livestock +
|
| 2023
| [https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/transhumance-the-seasonal-droving-of-livestock-01964 01964]
| Transhumance is a type of pastoralism or nomadism, a seasonal movement of livestock between fixed summer and winter pastures.
